First place all the libraries on the path where electron is present 
Copy 
- libstdc++.so.6  
- ld-linux-x86-64.so.0
- libc.so.6
- libgtk-x11-2.0.so.0 
  under the path .....src/node_modules/electron/dist . You can get this from Centos 7.2

Then Download [GCC](https://jlison.github.io/bin/centos6/soichih/mirror/gcc-4.7.2.tar.gz)
Extarct it to some folder and update LD_LIBRARY_PATH
glibpath=/opt/glib/ (path where you have extracted glib )

export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$glibpath/glib-2.49.4-kgesagxmtbemim2denf65on4iixy3miy/lib:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH

export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$glibpath/libffi-3.2.1-wk2luzhfdpbievnqqtu24pi774esyqye/lib64:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH

export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$glibpath/pcre-8.39-itdbuzevbtzqeqrvna47wstwczud67wx/lib:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH

export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$glibpath/gettext-0.19.8.1-aoweyaoufujdlobl7dphb2gdrhuhikil/lib:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH

Thanks a lot! I'll try this ASAP.

I'll let you know if I had any success.

Thanks for the tips!

Besides adding glib to LD_LIBRARY_PATH I also added **glibc:**
1. I downloaded glibc-2.17-106.el7_2.6.x86_64.rpm from [rpmfind](http://www.rpmfind.net/linux/rpm2html/search.php?query=glibc+2.17&submit=Search+...&system=&arch=), got the binaries (unzip or something) and added them to LD_LIBRARY_PATH.
2. Using [patchelf](http://nixos.org/patchelf.html) I updated two things to force the binary to use the updated **ld-linux** from **glibc-2.17**:

```
patchelf --set-interpreter /path/to/glibc/.../ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 /path/to/electron/bin/../electron
patchelf --replace-needed ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 /path/to/glibc/.../ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 /path/to/electron/bin/../electron
```
